title: Caring practice
body: I have found that the Drs.nurses and reception staff go out of their way to help and support you both on the phone and face to face.

title: Fantastic Practice
body:
I have been a patient at this practice for a number of years and have always found the Doctors and Staff to be efficient and professional.  There is a wonderful balance of familiarity and professionalism towards the patients that puts everyone at ease and makes every visit less traumatic.  I understand that I am not allowed to name names, but hopefully, one Doctor in particular will recognise themselves when I say that it is always a joy to be seen by them.  He/she is as nutty as a fruitcake and has a wonderful sense of humour which always leaves me in fits of laughter and leaves me confident that I am in safe hands.  Saying that, he/she, does seem to be obsessed about whether I am still smoking, but I stopped 12 months ago.

The Norvic practice have been brilliant whenever I have had any dealings with them, they were supportive and compassionate towards my Mother is her last few months and they were the same when my Father passed away in 1999.  I cannot speak highly enough of this practice.

title: Poor duty of care
body: Three times I’ve tried to contact this surgery or and appointment, and all three times I can’t even get on the call queue to make an appointment. When I do get through there is a “oh I’m sorry all the appointments have gone”, and that’s it. I realise it’s busy across the NHS but that doesn’t mean you can’t at least TRY to help?! Offer alternatives? Drop in centres? 111? Anything? This surgery and many like it appear to not care an ounce or realise how much worse it makes people feel when you can’t get the help you may need.

title: Covid 19 Vaccine Clinic
body: Well organised, efficient, on time, friendly and helpful. The best I have encountered in what is getting to be a routine experience.

title: Diabolical service
body: Took my husband to the E,D after being told to by minor injuries unit due to head injury that was getting worse over a few days. He was in severe pain with his head, and had signs of a possible bleed. He was triaged fairly quickly but that's about as good as it gets. The rest of the 17 Hours he spent in there consisted of being lied to by almost every member of the team to our faces, purely because they didn't know, or didn't want to deal with the questions so would just lie and say they will check or get something, then just didn't! We waited well over the allotted 5 hours to be seen by a doctor, only to be seen by another nurse who could not tell if it was serious enough so had to get the opinion of a doctor, which is what we were already waiting for. Waited another hour to be seen by the doctor, each time having to explain what the problem was, go through the same tests only to have her tell us that she didn't think it was serious but we should probably do a head scan even though he didn't actually qualify for one. He had a visible dent in his head! They told us this would be another hour, but after waiting another 3 we decided to leave. We were told we could not leave as he could die....if it was that serious why not treat him quicker. We were constantly told they would check up on the times, check with this doctor or that doctor etc etc and no one ever did what they said, we would watch them walk past the doctor to get a coffee and sit and chat at the computer desk not actually doing what they said. I complained after waiting over 1hr for the next set of pain relief in front of the whole ward, and this seemed to be the only way they would listen to me, which is not really on as we had been polite and patient up till around 12hrs of nothing being done. My husband was told 1hr for the scan, he actually waited another 7 Hours, then another hour after that to be told he had a fracture and to go home. They pumped him so full of morphine whenever he dared to ask a question, that it was obvious that they just didn't want to know, even after him explaining that the pain was not subsiding. All but one of the nurses were rude and arrogant, not answering a simple question even when speaking to their faces. They would come in and do his obs, and when questions as to why his heart rate was so low, did not even reply just shrugged it off, not even an explanation or ill get someone, just non responsive, it was so bad! The receptionist was awful, did not even look at you just barked questions. I get that there are people who abuse the A&E department but that does not mean that you have to treat everyone who comes in as a burden, my husband has left vowing never to go back to Derriford again. He was also not given any advice on what to do about his head apart from rest. Lets hope there isn't anything more serious going on as clearly Derriford A&E could not care less! I am so disappointed in the care from the once great NHS!

title: Still waiting for an appointment
body: I attended the neurology department for a first appointment in July 2022. I waited for 2 hours only to be told that the doctor was not available. I was put on the list for a future appointment. I am still waiting and my symptoms are getting worse. My gp told me to chase it up as another referral would mean that I would have to start again. No joy as departments do not answer their phones.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely GP’s but access not good
body:
I have been with this practice since 2004 and have always found the GPs kind, caring and willing to listen. Receptionist have been variable over the years, but currently are very helpful. The big issue is access - at times it can be very difficult make an appointment to see a GP. The call back system (if you can get on the list in the first place) doesn’t really work for those of us that work full time and can’t guarantee we will be available when the GP call comes through. On-line access is extremely limited and prone to closing without notice.
I fully understand the issues around the increasing local population and GP shortages, but it is such a shame that this is impacting on what used to be the best practice I have ever been registered at.
I notice only one GP appears to be full-time- perhaps reviewing the ratio of full-time to part-time staff might be something that would help improve the situation. I do think the use of nurse practitioners, paramedics, associate nurses/medics etc is a really helpful initiative in supporting access.
I really hope things start to improve over the coming months, so that more patients can use an otherwise excellent practice.

title: after 4wks i still cant a gp appt
body:
after spending several hours being caller no 18+ every weekday morning to try to get a gp appt, for last 4 weeks, i still have no gp appt and therefore no medical help. 

also after spending this many hours every weekday morning unsuccessfully to get a gp appt, i've used a lot of my strength & energy on this, when i am still back & forth to hospital with ongoing covid recovery and treatment, which has used up what little strength i have each day.

i really do not understand, why the practice only release a handful of appts for next few days, at a time and patients have to scramble to get one of these appointments. 

i really do not understand, why this gp practice only release a months worth of appointments at a time and especially as when these are released these are always gone, every month.

i really do not see how this system of releasing appts, allows for those of us, whom have physically limiting conditions, to access gp or any real help.

title: Excellent ongoing care and support
body: I have several health issues, some of which have flared up recently and I have had to make frequent phone calls and visits to the Wall House Surgery. Without exception, everyone I have come into contact with (receptionists, assessment team, nurses, doctors) have been kind, patient and supportive, even when I have been very reluctant to accept the inevitable trip to hospital. My health issues have a huge impact on my quality of life but I am so grateful I am registered with the Wall House Surgery, where I always receive excellent care. During the last week, which has been very difficult, several members of the team have gone 'above and beyond' to do all they could to help. Thank you.

title: Booster vacation
body:
I would  like  to  say  a big  thank you  to all the staff  and volunteers who  support  the vaccine  programme, 
it's  good  to be kind.
x

title: Miserable uncaring staff
body: Today I presented at the A&E Department with an eye infection/ cyst. I had previously seen my GP 6 days earlier, the infection had not largely improved. I was advised on the telephone the previous day by a member of staff in the eye clinic, the only possibility of an appointment with the eye clinic at the hospital was with a referral from my GP or present at A&E who should then be able to make a referral to the attached clinic. As my eye distortion/ disfigurement was causing me emotional distress, particularly as my work involves meeting a large number of senior business proprietors, I decided to travel 26 miles to the hospital. After the triage within the first 30 minutes, I waited 2.5 hours in the minor injuries unit, despite the presence of a white board in the waiting area there was no information displayed regarding wait time provided in the marked sections. I was then called into an anteroom where I was surprised that my appointment was with a nurse practitioner, not a doctor. I can see the benefit of this for minor injuries, however I was not greeted with  any empathy or kindness and felt from the onset some hostility when I said' I thought I was being seen by a doctor'. The nurse made notes and examined my eye. I was advised that the eye clinic 'do not normally allow appointments with patients presenting with an eye cyst' and that the fact that it was effecting my work 'would not be considered'. I managed to press for a referral to the eye clinic and explained that if my eye was recovered, I would then be able to cancel the appointment. This has been an upsetting experience. This trust is graded as 'Requires Improvement', I am very surprised that the 'caring' category is graded by the CQC as good. I did not find that this was an experience that I could remotely remark as caring. Normally I would not waste my time writing reviews. This experience has prompted me to do so as the hospital needs to start thinking more about every patients experience.

title: Very hard to get appointments
body: I tried on several days to use the online appointment request form - the only way to request an appointment with Studholme.  It was constantly closed due to high volume. On Friday morning I tried at 0800 but couldn’t get on the form, some online problem.  I went to the surgery and a man took my name and date of birth and reason for wanting an appointment. Said I’d get a text later with a date for an appointment. Waited all day and heard nothing. Will now have to start all over again after the bank holiday.  This is typical of trying to get an appointment at Studholme since the pandemic. I’m considering moving to another surgery after 40 years.

title: Lack of communication
body:
My partner had to cancel her appointment last Tuesday but was promised a telephone call
This never happened & she rang 5 times but could not get ananswer

title: Incomprehensive planning system
body:
For a weekend visit in England, my partner had a domestic accident resulting in a 7cm and quite deep flesh wound. At arrival, registration and first assessement went quite smoothly and quick. Then, after a more than one hour wait off to another area, with again more waiting. Then, after practically 2hrs, finally a nurse came to have a look at the fleshwound. Get in the consultant, need more examinations. Ok...
Then, change of shift of doctors, and when we asked when she would finally be stitched up, the answer was that the computer decided when it would be her turn. If they had only done everything at once it would have been much more efficient and over and done with. Now, we're up to 5hrs of stay in the hospital, with maybe 15 minutes of actual treatment time. We fully understand that emergency departments are overcrowded and understaffed. But this ridiculous "planning" or "treatment" system is not efficient nor helping at all.

title: There are better surgeries
body:
This surgery is big enough to support thousands of local North Londoners and has a phone appointment system that can get you an appointment. Some of the GPs are kind and knowledgeable.

However, the practice suffers from poor management and a reliance on text messaging patients at every opportunity. Texts are only ever one way, leaving no opportunity for proper interaction or personalisation. 

Go to a smaller practice for a better service.

title: Efficient service
body: On 1st May 2023 I broke my radius at garden  centre and was dealt with the utmost professionalism with a quick diagnosis once seen. The only drawback was the three hour wait time. The nurse dealing with me was very sympathetic and helpful.

title: Terrible patient service
body: Family member filled in the kllinik form online as there is now no way to book an appointment with a human being. Got a message back saying the receptionists had been advised to book him a face to face appointment. 5 days later still no appointment or any contact whatsoever from this useless surgery .No wonder they are classed inadequate and A&E are so overworked . It's the only way you get to see a doctor now .

title: Care of patient 6.5.23
body: Relative went for a simple blood test at 13:30. Was still here at 22:05. No comms between patient and doctor. Told no admittance required, then told you're being admitted. Now not necessary. Waited almost 2 hours for discharge, removal of cannula and medication. Still dont know who the doctor is, waiting times are off the chart, and care not up to standards. Relative now has to come back next Tuesday to have all these done again. This is not acceptable!

author: Karl 1
title: Visit to ED
body:
I visited ED for my family member for 10pm after 111 person said to go in for 10pm. On arrival we were told it was not an appointment. The sign on the ED reception said 2-3 hour wait.  
Went in and waited. Saw Nurse Steve who triaged. Then said would wait for doctor. After 4-5 hours checked with reception for update and told would see doctor next. Another 2 hours later called by doctor, who kindly offered food as it had been so long.  
The waiting room had a tv that was unplugged and not in use, a hot drink dispenser that did not work and a cold water unit with no cups. Also at no time were updates displayed or shown in the waiting room, the staff were busy and the waiting area was full, but it would have been nice to have seen some updates. Also all the lights were on in the waiting area and there was no dimly lit areas to move to, which would have been nice for an overnight visit to the department. This was frustrating for a long wait. However, the area was clean looked tidy.  
After assessment, review and outcome we left after just over 7 hours. However, the sign on the reception showed wait times were now 3-4 hours. So this was not accurate.  
All in all the staff were great and delivered excellent care, but the waiting area was disappointing.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful service
body: I was camping at Ripon and had stitches on my outer ear before my holiday but they weren’t dissolving as they should so went along to the hospital and asked if they could help me , amazing staff very friendly and took the stitches out I can’t thank you enough for your help , 5* service

title: Phone call listen to problem
body: If you need specific blood tests they are swiftly booked and always accommodate test dates required.

title: Poor practice
body: Can never get a face to face appointment, you can never see your doctor. Having lots of issues with prescriptions and they never help, just tell you to call 111

title: Terrible Hospital
body: It is a terrible department. There were no doctors. My daughter was suffering from pain in her ears for more than four hours but we were still asked to wait for the doctor to visit her. After waiting for more than four hours I noticed that there were no doctors. There were only nurses in the department and when I was going out of the department after four hours, they even didn’t try to prevent us from leaving. That means that my daughter’s illness was not important for them at all. I also have to mention that the nurses were very lazy and rude and not doing anything special at all. All the time they were sitting by the computers and doing nothing. I never recommend this hospital.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Quick and efficient
body: I did my cervical screening test here and the nurse was very quick and efficient with her task. The Poplars' atmosphere was very pleasant as well.

title: Very efficient
body:
I liked the fact that my medical issue did not take up the GP’s time and resolved by the local pharmacist on the same day and prescribed medication after a consultation, apparently this is a new procedure they are trialling, well done! Hopefully this will ease the pressures 

The receptionist are always very helpful & professional

title: Grateful and appreciative for what you do for…
body:
I was checked up promptly by the triage nurse, who recognised I had quite severe symptoms and put me straight through to the A and E ward. Every one of the staff I dealt with were clearly busy but did everything they could for me. The treatment began working after a few hours or so after five days of difficulty swallowing, swollen throat, loss of appetite and dehydration. After a couple more hours I was able to go home and could drink again with far less pain and discomfort. I hope not to be coming back too soon though ! 
A great job you all do. Many thanks.

title: Friendly/helpful doctors
body: Always feel the doctors truly care when I visit, they listen , and go the extra mile to make me feel better.

title: All round the best hospital around
body:
Went in by 999 through A&E with a really bad chest infection, however also had covid, so ended up in an isolation ward, ward 444 great all round the staff should get a decent pay rise, from HCA to doctors and nurses the care was absolutely pain free
Thank you countess staff you're great

author: scoreboardgp49
title: A brilliant service.
body:
I was in my first trimester of pregnancy in November 2022 when I noticed I was bleeding. I contacted the EPPC in CAH and got an appointment for 2 days later. I had already accepted the outcome and knew what had happened, however on the Thursday it was confirmed I had a miscarriage. The senior nurse who I think was called Katie was brilliant. She gave me options on the next steps and decided I would allow things to happen naturally and attend for a review on the Tuesday back at EPPC.  
When I attended on the Tuesday things had not fully progressed naturally and I had to have a procedure at the bedside. The doctor and nurse were brilliant and I couldn't have asked for better care. SN Marion I believe was covering from another ward and provided first class care.  
I was aware when I went in there were 2 other couples in the waiting area, the unit was short staffed and running behind on time but not once did I feel my procedure or consultation was rushed in any way.  
The waiting room is very small that's my only negative feedback. The EPPC is a brilliant service.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: An exemplary medical student
body:
My appointment began with a young medical student before seeing a G.P. He was very polite, listened to my problem, was very thorough in his examination and agreed with my observations as I had experienced this problem before. He then called the G.P. in and whilst discussing me with her I was completely included in the conversation.
I felt totaly at ease throughout the whole appointment and the diagnosis and medication prescribed  began to relieve the pain I was in almost immediately .

title: Poor after care
body: I had a gastric sleeve, the surgeon was amazing. The aftercare in the hospital was brilliant however they knew very little about the procedure and what I could have to drink or eat. The baratric after care has been very poor yhe communication has been very limited and left to own devices. This was not sold to me when first coming for the consultation so I feel I was falsely led.

title: Very impressed
body:
Was a pleasant atmosphere...clean and modern inside and out , was seen on time which made a nice change from East Surrey Hospital which isn't clean ! And never seen on time.
Was also very impressed with the short waiting list .
The Neurological Consultant was extremely pleasant and professional... I liked him ..very nice man and easy to talk to....he reassured me when answering my many questions.

title: Great practice but
body: The staff, doctors and nurses are all very kind and helpful but my complaint is the booking system. when phoning for an appointment at 8.30 on the dot there is always a queue of dozens of people, you either get cut off or when it is your turn all the appointments are taken for the day. I work and I find it difficult to hang on to the phone for any length of time. There must be a way of booking online to see what day and times are available, I know that in an emergency there may not be anything available on the day so the A and E may be the only way to be seen. If paitients who are ok with online booking can do this it would leave the telephone system for patients who are not so confident online.

title: Humbling experience
body:
Urology department.
From the receptionist to nurses to anaesthetists to surgeons.
All were exceptional.
The nurses were very informative and helpful in urology. They checked all my after care details and really went out of their way to find out all the information that I needed.
The Anaesthetists were very careful considering my past episode. They were very careful and really calmed me down and kept me informed despite the pain and nerves. The surgeon Doctors, who were my previous surgeons  were amazing. They explained the procedure clearly. The surgeon returned to see me after the surgery and explained the situation and the following after care.
Thank you also to the helpful student nurses and cleaners
Thanks to all who helped me.
I was very humbled

title: Parking fine
body: Parked for 30 mins with blue badge on show and received a parking fine, this seems to be a problem with this facility according to the other reviews

title: Phone charges
body: Because you cannot book an appointment on line which is not acceptable you are forced to phone. This is a warning to all be careful how long you stay on the call. The surgery phone number is for some reason a national number and if you are in the queue you see your phone bill rocket. A 10mins call is £2.50. I wonder hiw much the surgery majesty on this. I have one call cost me over £10. The auto message should advise of the cost for staying in the queue. Get the online booking sorted please Village Surgery.

title: Telephone Consultation
body: Telephone consultation was easy to set-up, very convenient and just as effective as a face to face consultation.

title: Good Practice
body: Just like to let you know how impressed I was by the “Hub” respiration clinic, which I attended last Sunday. The doctor I saw provided in depth information on my condition and there seemed to be no rush. I felt properly looked after and cared about. Overall, very impressed. Thank you.

title: Impossible to get through to anyone
body: We have been patients at StLukes for 18 years and luckily don’t need to attend very often. I’ve always found the team good when you can see them. The problem now is that it is impossible to get through to the practice if you need an appointment. We phone at 8 am and get the message that the queue is at capacity then get cut off, if you are lucky to get in the queue you then get cut off after waiting with a message saying appointments are gone. Other GP practices still answer their phones and just closing off all contact if appointments leaves patients with no way to communicate their issues. I really worry for frail or elderly people who must feel totally abandoned. a&E and 111 calls for the surgery must be sky high as you have no other option. I’ve been trying for weeks to get an appointment for my daughter but no luck. I did get a LIVi appointment through the app which was helpful but they said she needed face to face with a Gp within 2 weeks, they communicated this with the practice but 3 weeks later we still can’t not get in. I wish something could be done to improve things for local people who have no other options.  Duston needs another Gp Surgery as St Luke’s obviously cannot cope.

title: Great practice
body: every time we  call the gp we always get a face to face or telephone consultation on the day or next day.  and all referrals are swift and efficient. over all great service.

title: No appointments
body: I need a referral for hospital xray. But told I can't get one unless I get appointment with my gp. This is impossible and to think they are taking on new patients is laughable. Not been able to get face to face appointment for year n a half absolute joke please sort it out unless you queue up at 7am u can't see a doctor. I've been diagnosed with cellilitus over phone to be told by a&e Dr it isn't and need a xray but I need referral by gp I could cry I'm in pain in both legs

title: Friendly Receptionist and Admission Clerk
body: I had an endoscopy sedation.  I was made to leave the premises under heavy sedation.  I was taken to the main hospital by my partner, but was not aware of this.  I feel I was not given enough time to recover from the sedation like other people were.   I waited for a long time, but this was not a problem.  Just wanted to be treated like others.

title: Avoid
body: I usually get an annual diabetes eye check each year as I have diabetes. I hadn't received an appointment for this year. I phoned the service provider up. They booked an appointment for me. I asked why I didn't get the automatic referral as in previous years and they explained that that was down to this GP surgery who must have cancelled the automatic referral. I would ask why they would do that but it is typical of how they work.

title: Brilliant!!
body:
I’ve been with Falkland House for a fair few years now, and I’ve always said how impressed I am with their service and professionalism. 
Yesterday reaffirmed my praise! 
I called in the morning and got in the queue to speak to reception, it didn’t take too long even though I was 17th in line. Arrange a call back with my Dr, who called within a couple hours. 
After discussing my pain, I was booked in for a walk in service X-Ray the same day and booked in for physio for Friday. 
I just think the whole team runs the surgery incredible well and others should take a lead from their book. 
I can’t recommend this place highly enough! Sometimes you just need to give credit where credits due!

title: Amazing care and experience
body: Thank you to a & e and all the staff and Bridgend hospital. From the desk at a & e to the x ray department, ultra sound scan team and fracture clinic. I came in with a damaged elbow which took the sails out of me and shook me up. I must’ve spoken to and dealt with by at least 20 members of staff over a period of 3 days and they all treated me with genuine care and made me feel like a person and not a number. So thank you. I hope I don’t see any of you again except in Tesco or Tenby. With care like that, it’s good to know that my children and their children are in safe hands. You’re all amazing. Thank you very much.

author: bluesky09
title: Physiotherapy
body:
I suffer from migraines and had some neck pain recently which didn't help. I was referred to physiotherapy sessions in the southern trust. My physiotherapist was Anthony. He put me at ease and the course of physiotherapy treatment given helped relax and release head pain immensely and stretched out my neck as well. I am able to move much better and without stiffness and am better aware of my posture also.  
Anthony outlined useful stretches and demonstrated and watched my technique to see I understood. He also used massage techniques to improve my neck flexibility. I am very grateful to him for all his hard work helping me feel much better and for his high level of patient care demonstrated at every appointment. Thank you

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good practice
body: Send me a specialist . the nurses are very kind, I get answers to all my questions and they arrive very quickly, the prescriptions arrive at the pharmacy, I can contact a specialist in a very short time, I get messages to remind me what I have to do for my health

title: Wonderful service
body:
I arrived at the MIU late on a Sunday evening with a damaged foot.
Was seen very quickly and immediately diagnosed with a suspected fracture.  The nurse was extremely helpful and friendly.  
Fitted with a boot and advised to go to Macclesfield general for an X-ray.
The diagnostic was spot on.
Such a wonderful facility to have in Buxton
Thank you 🙏🏿

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Shrewsbury A&E
body: After attending A&E I needed emergency surgery, this was dealt with swiftly, but the nursing staff were not fully qualified, and had little knowledge, a canula was inserted and used but not done correctly which left me covered in blood and a very sore hand where the plastic had vent under my skin!I take blood thinners and they were stopped before surgery when I asked the next morning they hadn’t been given to me! As directed by the surgeon! The bed sheets had blood stains on them, and the toilets were dirty, this was my first and last visit to the Shrewsbury A&E department.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Amazing
body: I am due to have a tooth extracted shortly (Root Canal problem) It flared up massively yesterday and I was desperate for a solution.With it being Coronation weekend I had no chance of speaking to my local dentist until Tuesday and rang the emergency number the practice gave me.I got hold of Larkfield Practice via the number and was given an appointment 80 mins later.The people there were amazing.Super friendly and positive from meeting me to sorting me.I am sure you know who you are ! I wish I could mention your names but I can't.Thankyou all of you for what you did !

title: Lack of Communication
body:
This comment relates specifically to the Pals function of the nhs which as far as I am concerned is non-responsive/non-existent.
I have had occasion to contact Pals at the Hallamshire on 2 occasions this year and Pals at the Royal,Chesterfield on several occasions. A response has never been forthcoming. How are you supposed to get assistance when departments are performing poorly when even Pals do not respond. 
The Administration and bookings teams need a good shake-up if the nhs is to avoid needlessly wasting money.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: First rate
body: Went in with badly swollen.  Turned out to be shingles.  Was seen by efficient, friendly and professional staff.  Careful attention.  Left with the medicine I needed.  Could not have been better.

title: Bad experience
body: I opened up in my initial assessment because I thought I could and have now been referred to child services even though my mental health doesn’t affect my children and they are not in any danger.  Now I cannot trust any health professionals

title: Quiet and efficient
body: I had to call an ambulance to go to A&E on 5th May 2023.   I would like to express my appreciation for the quiet and efficient way the A&E Department was run that day.   I was well looked after.   Many thanks

title: Lovely staff
body: What a lovely group of staff working here today when I brought our daughter in following a referral from 111. I just wanted to thank you all for your kindness and caring attitudes. You made our visit as relaxed as it could be. Thank you 🙏🏼

title: Extremely Good Practice
body: Staff really made me feel at ease, very pleasant. Tremendous service. Thank you, would recommend.....

title: Good news, I hope!
body:
I read, with great interest that there is a new owner of our local GP practice. From the recent reviews it seems that we may, at last, receive proper service that we are legally entitled to. I hope so very much. We have been very poorly served in recent years and no one, including local NHS managers, seemed to care.
Fingers crossed!

title: Great Practice
body: I have heard others complaining that it’s impossible to get appointments at GPs, yet i’ve not once failed to get an appointment with Moseley Avenue Surgery. Whenever I needed to be seen, they provided. The staff are all lovely, the GPs themselves are as friendly as it can get, i have not one complaint regarding the entire experience.

title: Unprofessional/casual
body: I attended the A&E department following a fall. I was in severe pain but when I was eventually seen I described my symptoms as best as I was able. The subsequent X ray showed no damage to the knee and I was sent home with an appointment for the fracture clinic which I duly attended. Neither of these clinics bothered to X ray my hip despite being made aware of a prosthetic joint and it emerged later that there was in fact a serious ring fracture around the prosthetic hip joint. I was subsequently admitted for urgent remedial surgery. I now have extensive metal bracing and scarring and am looking at a lengthy recovery period. I can't help but speculate about a very different outcome if the damage had been spotted on the first or the second visit. The upside is that once known, action was taken, and the treatment from that point on was good

title: Interrogation
body: I found most of the staff I encountered to be friendly, professional and caring, all except 1. I attended A&E following above from 111 due to some palpitations and mild chest pain. I was initially seen relatively quickly and had what felt like appropriate checks. Waited around 2 hours for results of blood test and this is where it went a little wrong. I sat in the waiting area, where they told me to go. But the doctor said he couldn't find me. He telephoned me and said "I have hope results, please don't hang up until I find you, I can't afford to lose you again" instantly I'm worried. He takes me into a small room with just 2 chairs. He does not tell me my test results but proceeds to question me about my symptoms. When I told him he was making me feel rather worried, he pulled a face and said "am I? And why is that? This is how things work" his attitude was not very nice and I think purposely trying to make me feel that I was in the wrong. It was horrible. I just think if someone comes in for tests on their heart and the results are OK, lead with that. I don't think I've ever been so frightened in a conversation in my life. I had to ask him twice what the results said. Disgusting. I would not visit this department out of choice following this experience

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Varied experience
body: My appointment with the nurse practitioner went well but, trying to get an appointment was a different story, I phoned in the morning and it wasn’t until after being shunted to a pharmacy and back that early that evening I was given an appointment for the next day . I tried the online services that I was recommended (over the phone) system online and the NHS website, but both these services told me I was unable to use their systems.

title: Total Lack of Empathy.. Patient Care ..and…
body: Having been a patient at this practice for many years.. I have witnessed and experienced the gradual drop in patient care and support demonstrated by this practice. There is no point in changing my GP as unfortunately reports received from others would confirm the complete failure of the GP system here in Warrington and Nationally.

title: Hard to get an appointment
body: I have been calling for months as I have a severe pain in my shoulder that I can even move it. Trying to call almost everyday but its si hard get through the phone lines dont open until 8.01 when you get the queu its absolute ridiculous been waiting for hours to say that no appoints call back again next day, calling again been in the 1st for long time after 30 min call finish as they say is too busy call again get 1st in queu and again too busy call later. That its absolute ridiculous, and still waiting to get an appointment

title: Pointless
body:
Referred by 111 and after an initial assessment and some tests I was told it should be less than two hours to see the doctor.   Three and a half hours later in the major unit we were told that it was likely to be another 4.5hrs minimum, but that would probably go up as more urgent cases would be likely to come in and there was only one qualified nurse in the area.

As my pain was becoming unbearable due to the waiting conditions (I needed to lie down) and I had inferred that I was not in immediate mortal risk I decided  to go home and try to treat myself where I was more comfortable.

It would have been good to have a grown up conversation with someone about my options and the risks, but I was simply told it's up to you.  I also don't understand why it is not possible to go home and come back when the waiting time is so long, so that patients can be more comfortable and the conditions are better for the remaining patients.  A functioning GP system would also be useful in reducing the numbers at A&E in the first place.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Dreadful. Still waiting for the telephone call.
body: I was referred to the clinic in 2020. To cut a long story short there has been no reply to 2 GP letters and I am still waiting  for the August 2022 phone call. I feel uncared for and totally let down.

title: Led me to panic attack
body:
After growth scan, had to spend 4 hours overall in waiting room to be seen. As result, only thing I received is printed leaflet and was told that will receive a call within 1 week to have a follow up appointment! To wait 4 hours in a smelly waiting room to get printed paper (which I could find myself on NHS website) and information about follow up appointment (which I could get by phone) ??? 
In addition, on my arrival, I was told by security that I am not able to get the ticket to pay parking because barrier is broken and I don’t need to pay. When I came back to my car I found parking notice charge!!! So, when I called security again, they were completely indifferent and unprofessional!

I am 37 weeks pregnant. Instead of receiving qualified support, the Maternity unit service made me feel just anxious and led me to the panic attack.

title: Always closed for emergency walk in !
body: For the 3rd time I’ve gone here for emergency help and care and for a 3rd time the site says open but you get there and it’s closed the reception is rude and for a second time I got told can you not read the sign it is closed go to Glastonbury!! Completely rude and quite frankly annoying in an emergency! If you’re closed say so on the site so we don’t waste our time and go straight to Glastonbury and maybe the receptionists can learn some compassion and customer service!

title: Shocking receptionists
body: I have been a patient here for a number of years and I find the reception staff in particular very unapproachable and unhelpful. In March in particular the receptionist asked my condition, I gave her a long list of my problems and told her I had been trying to get an appointment for three months only to be told there’s nothing she could do. A nurse walked past and heard the conversation and rectified the issue and got me an appointment for the same day with a doctor. The receptionist didn’t even try! My notes clearly show I’m am a complex patient and I told her as such but she showed no care or compassion! I now have anxiety making appointments because of this

author: lifeDestroyed88
title: Left without any care and treatment
body:
I have been left infertile. My surgery was cancelled a week out, no real reason given. They blamed information prior to going to Leeds gender service, when obviously they evaluated all that before referring me for surgery. Then tell me they can cancel a surgery any time, as many times as they want up to the day prior to surgery, despite the referral accepted and processed and surgery assessment date set.  
Already over 10 years of transition, now no access to services anywhere. I am left a shemale with a beard and infertile. Can't travel with bad autism. The trust has ignored my autism pleas for help and understanding despite making me a promise that such help will be put in place. Penalised me for contacting for patient transport letter for surgery with my autism, and responded on the complaint that they fully expect all people to make their own way to surgery, so total disregard if you are disabled with autism.  
If I did not have autism I could maybe get a transition in 25/30 years total, maybe never. I am just left like this contemplating ending my life.

author: Very-nervous-lady
title: My broken leg
body:
I went over on my ankle, dislocated it, fractured it and broke my fibula. Went to Forth Valley Hospital where I was informed I would need surgery. Prior to surgery they wanted to manipulate my ankle back into place... Well, I was terrified. Petrified that it was going to be excruciating.  
Got down to the plaster room where I was met by NA's Nicole and Claire. They immediately made me feel at ease, they had the best sense of humour, made me laugh, took my mind of it all and took everything at my pace. They put up with my ugly crying. The doctor called Damien was also fantastic and done his best to straighten my leg. He got my toes pointing in the right direction which was brilliant. All three really did go out their way to show me empathy and helped me through it.  
Fast forward 2 weeks and I attended outpatients to change my plaster and get my stitches taken out after my surgery and I was seen by Nicole and Claire again. This immediately put me at ease as let's face it I am a wimp when it comes to it and I had gotten myself worked up again. But knowing that I was in their capable hands, I knew I didn't have to worry. I can't honestly describe how brilliant they are at their jobs. Julie the qualified staff member came to see me in the plaster room as well and was so lovely, again put me at ease and explained everything that was going on with my leg. I cannot praise these staff members enough.

title: Exceptional Service
body:
I arrived at A and E with my 17 year old daughter who is suffering with chronic OCD.
We were greeted by a helpful receptionist that collected our details and directed us to the appropriate waiting area. 
We arrived at around 9.30am and came into contact with around 6 members of nursing/medical staff from A and E and the mental health team. Every single team member treated us as if we were the first patient they had seen that day, listened to the issues and provided advice and guidance. We were provided with an exceptional service at all times from every member of staff that we engaged with.
One of the Dr's even brought my daughter a sandwich as we were there over lunch time!
We really appreciated the care and thoughtfulness of all of the staff working in A and E and are extremely thankful.

author: Coco10
title: The whole postnatal ordeal was ultimately traumatic
body:
In the community my post natal care was neglectful. I expressed to my community midwife several times on her visits 1 & 2 days postnatal about extreme pain in abdomen it was dismissed. At 4 days postnatal hours before her next visit I was admitted to hospital with sepsis. I had strep A in my uterus, developing an abscess in my fallopian tube and became septic as this had not been treated ultimately due to her dismissing my concerns of pain. I was in hospital for 4 weeks on an intensive course of IV antibiotics, with no therapeutic effect which resulted in me requiring an escalation of care - transferred to HDU- keyhole surgery & a laparotomy.  
My community care was neglectful. My inpatient care was complex & the whole postnatal ordeal was ultimately traumatic.

title: Student nurse was dissatisfied
body: My friend came up to use a&e and received the worst treatment. Student nurse didn’t ask if she was pregnant or anything before having an X-ray, just assumed. Then after, I made a joke saying that my friend can have some tramadol for the pain they were in and the student nurse agreed even though my friend wasn’t prescribed it. Very bad practice from a Keele University student nurse, and would not recommend this a&e.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Awful treatment
body:
Having an elderly parent in hospital can be stressful enough. Add in the total lack of care, respect and dignity that, that person is shown is intolerable. The extremely brusque attitude of multiple staff on Lydon 5 & seemingly uncaring nature does not give any amount of confidence that your parent is being cared for.
Unattended bay with several confused patients that are relying on other people's relatives to ensure that they don't have a fallout of bed or are not lying in faecal matter for 20 + minutes at a time (witnessed first hand) is completely unacceptable. When calling for assistance with either ones own relative or for another patient to be meet with arguments between staff as to who is going to help!
Finding a parent in bed at 11am who has not been given breakfast or a hot drink is distressing and hearing that the HCA had 2 other people on that bay to feed and so your parent went without is wholy unacceptable. People do not recover without good nutrition and the right care. It appears this ward is a dumping ground for patients who seemingly the hospital does not know what to do with and likewise staff who wouldn't last 5 minutes on an efficiently run ward such as Priory 4, where the patient was moved from.
Add into this the stark difference in cleanliness from one floor to another, you'd think you were in a different place altogether. 
Seriously Sandwell get your act together and sort out Floor 5, your staff and the equipment graveyard which appears on the majority of corridors.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Wish I'd registered somewhere else
body: After moving to the area, I registered here, but have received multiple issues since registering. I have tried to change GPs but no where in the area is taking new patients, who already have a GP (so check out reviews before picking a practice). I thought the care would be the same everywhere, but I've had difficulty getting my medications, getting reviews, and getting treatment for my health conditions. The E consults often don't get responded to (online requests), it's difficult to get hold of anyone on the phone, and I've even tried going into the practice. I often feel like I'm just going round in circles.

title: Really gone downhill
body:
Pre-pandemic and even during the pandemic this was a perfectly good surgery, the service was never amazing but it got the job done. Now you have to wait on hold for anything up to an hour only to be passed through to clinical support who can’t even help you anyway and then you’re on hold again for another hour for a doctor or waiting for a doctor to call you back, which means the surgery is basically unusable for anyone who works full time. 
I’m not even asking for face to face appointments - the ability to book short telephone appointments online with a doctor/nurse during the pandemic was great and needs to be brought back. All you can book now is vaccines and smear tests. 
Very disappointing from a surgery my whole family has been using for decades.

title: Automatic phone line
body: Trying to make an appointment at this surgery is horrendous. I barely use the drs surgery and the only time I need it for are when my children are sick, and the call line is always full. I called non stop between 7.59 amd 8am on the dot and it was already full. They need a new system for people who actually need to see a gp and those who just need a phone appointment.

title: Disgrace of a surgrry
body:
This surgery is useless. The receptionists and doctors are all useless. They either give up looking into your illness and just blame everything on anxiety when it obviously isn't, or you can't get an appointment because they're apparently at capacity at 8:01am.

They need investigating and shutting down permanently.

title: Cant get through
body: Tried several days in a row cant get through to make an appointment.  Also tried using internet, still being directed to call the surgery, extremely annoying.

title: Practice has gone downhill
body: Really unhappy with the service from this practice recently. You have to use ask my gp to for help which is usually fine, better even, however the practice only opens the service for approx 10 minutes when they are short staffed can only assume this is to boost practice stats e.g time taken to respond to a case however this has a massive negative impact on the patients attempting to get help.

title: There has to be a better appointments system
body:
I connected to the switchboard (followed by 2 minutes of complete silence which made me think my phone had gone dead) at 08:00 (this after pressing redial 20 times or so from 07:58 onwards). I was then subjected to the most irritating hold music ever composed: a very-much too jaunty and repetitive piece (for xylophone and guitar as far as I could make out - it is an extremely lo-fi recording).  At about 08:10 they announced (the first such announcement) that I was number 38 in the queue. I was finally dealt with around 08:25 - by which point I was beginning to wonder whether any illness I might have could possibly be as bad as continuing to listen to the provided hold music.

All this for a completely non-urgent matter for which I did not require a same day appointment.

I am retired, but my wife (a teacher) still works for a living. This system is dreadful for me but completely unusable for her. Even if I can arrange for her to get a phone call from a GP, she can't just walk out of her classroom when her phone goes off at some random time of day. She could easily take time off for an appointment, but she needs to provide *notice*.

There has to be a better system than this!

title: Can get a doctors appointment
body: I rang this morning at 8:30 presses option one to speak to a doctor and had an automated message saying they are too busy and to call back later. This was as 8:30. I tried another 3 times and got the same message. My issue is not life threatening but it is affecting my life and very important I get to speak to a doctor. How do I get to do this?

title: Terrible practice
body: Tried to ring to speak to some on advice of a paramedic but that is not possible, directs you to e consult which takes up to 3 days to get a response. There are options to complete e consult over the phone or another option to speak to a person but these are constantly engaged.  Its almost like patients are an inconvenience. Appalling service and would not recommend to anyone.  Taking steps to move to another surgery

title: Appointment system
body: This is a great surgery however it’s appointment booking system needs improvement constantly calling until you get through is like a lottery I believe a call back system will be more time efficient and a positive improvement to the surgery

title: Impossible to get an appointment if you work
body: Appointments need to be made by phoning or attending at 8am. I am travelling to work at this time so this is not possible. On rare occasions when I am able to ring, there are no appointments left and booking for another day is not allowed. As a result I have not had a face to face appointment at this surgery for years.

title: Unable to book a forward appointment
body:
Couldn't get through as volume of calls so had a call back.
I told the person on the phone I had been in a lot of pain in my foot for over two weeks (arthritis) and need a GP to give me advice.
No apps for today - I said I didn't expect today, please can I book a forward app - no unable to do. Very uncaring and I have no where to go for care. This situation is so depressing! I am not demanding to be seen to day but to be seen at a time convenient to the GP's.

title: Awful admin
body: Nearly every single time I have to deal with this place something goes wrong regarding admin and staff just blame colleagues. My most recent experience was handing in an exemption form. 4 weeks later I called to ask what was happening with it and I was told that it was still in the basket but the doctor would sign it that day. More than 2 weeks later I chased again and I've been told that it was signed a week ago and sent to Newcastle! This is the first I'd heard that it needs to go elsewhere, I'd previously been told it would be sent to me. My next prescription is due in 7 days and when I asked how long it takes for Newcastle to do their part I was told, "just depends". Tremendous. Oh, and no apology from the staff member for the weeks it spent in the basket as "that wasn't me". They can't even be bothered to update their telephone number on Google or this website!

title: helpless staff in the reception
body: It is literary impossible to book an appointment in The Arch Medical Practice. If you ask for an appointment in the reception the answer is "book it in the app". If you open the app there is a written "contact your GP" If you call your GP the answer is "We can't book an appointment for you today. Call tomorrow at 8 am. When you do so, the line is busy. After a long time of waiting or calling many times until there is an answer You receive the same info as the day before or they say come to reception tomorrow morning. And the round starts again. It is a never-ending story when you can never have an appointment. The worst is receptionists feel free to say "You do not need an appointment" or even cancel it when you do have some booked by your doctor and say we canceled it because you do not need it.

author: RelaxedBeachCat
title: Visualisation for Relaxation
body: I attended the course and found it really enjoyable. I definitely felt more relaxed by the end of it and enjoyed my time wandering around my garden.

author: Emmgh49
title: Staff are doing a wonderful job
body:
I have been on the trauma ward for nearly three weeks, when I arrived I came straight up to the ward and was given my own room which I feel very comfortable in.  
The care I have received is very good, the only way to describe it is first class. The staff are great and the communication with them has been very clear and consistent. The food is excellent I'm really impressed with everything, the staff are doing a wonderful job.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: revmjs73
title: Clear, explanatory, and hands on physio
body:
I attended an appointment for back and leg pains with physiotherapist Adam at the Surgery, and received a full and thorough consultation.  
Not only was Adam clear, explanatory, and hands on, but he also referred me further for blood tests and an x-ray to ensure all bases will be covered.

author: Colin Duffy
title: The experience was nothing short of remarkable.
body:
Following a bad fall in my garden resulting in a broken wrist & badly bruised coccyx I was referred to Forth Valley Hospital.  
The experience was nothing short of remarkable. I was booked in, x-rayed, triaged (by Karen) and treated in less than an hour.  
This is an astonishing testament to an NHS which has suffered underfunding. To see such professionalism, dedication and humanity is lesson in public service.

author: Euanjnr
title: I’m frankly blown away by the service I received.
body:
I recently injured my knee on a trek and after a couple of days of rest at home decided I should really see a professional as it wasn’t healing as fast as I would have liked.  
With only two days before I had to return to work I called 111 in the morning hoping I could somehow be seen before then.  
Much to my surprise I was given an appointment for two hours later. I had been examined, X-rayed, discussed the results and was back in my car reassured all within 45 minutes...  
I’m frankly blown away by the service I received.  
10/10 ladies :)

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

author: Kmcg
title: Urgent Gynaecology Appointment
body:
I went to see my GP on Tuesday last week after having a few symptoms.  
I was put on the cancer pathway to be reviewed urgently within 2 weeks. 3 days later I was in Treliske Gynaecology department and full reassurance and sympathy was given.  
Lovely and caring staff members with amazing service.

author: Charlie2307
title: Hospital staff were great.
body: I had cut bites, and had to have hand surgery on both hands. Hospital staff were great. Follow up at OPD to clean and redress wounds, and the staff in the dept. were excellent from start to finish.

author: McHeart
title: I was genuinely impressed with the treatment I was given
body:
This story relates to a totally unexpected and unplanned visit to the Cardiac Assessment Unit which is a walk-in facility attached to the large County Hospital in Omagh, where I was given 5 star treatment from every member of staff that I interacted with.  
Following a steadily increasing amount of discomfort centred around my heart, often after manual exertion, I finally decided that I should get some sort of professional help.  
I felt as if I was approaching that Heart Attack/Stroke zone which was a line that I hadn’t planned to cross just yet. I had accidentally discovered that this unit exists only a month earlier and had no preconceived ideas about its capabilities.  
The Hospital is well signposted and easy to find and even has a free part to the car park most welcome. Having found the Cardiac Assessment Unit and reported to reception, I was asked to take a seat and was fully expecting the usual 2- 4 hour wait however a friendly face appeared after 2 minutes, called my name and led me to a private room where I was interviewed and hooked up to various pieces of equipment for ECG, blood pressure measurements and more.  
Prior to entering the room, I noticed a red framed award on the wall which had been earned by the local staff for excellent conduct - can’t be bad.  
Unfortunately, the ECG results told another story and showed Atrial Fibrillation which meant that I was to be confined to barracks until the condition normalised with the aid of medication.  
I had no phone chargers, changes of clothing, wash kit, toothpaste etc however the staff found me everything they could to make me comfortable.  
Tea and toast kept arriving and (without ringing any bells or even asking).  
I was also given various reading material to help me understand the workings of the heart and solid commercial advice on what medical gadgets to buy. For example I can now obtain my ECG and heart rate readings in moments with an inexpensive unit which blue tooth's to my phone and gives a real time waveform which is then interpreted for you. That unit is FDA approved. There are various wearable smartwatches which do similar things and gather a history of your condition - could be useful.  
I was genuinely impressed with the treatment I was given, both professionally and through kindness empathy and care, enough to ask if there was a feedback process for me to share my experiences with others and hence this post.  
Thank you Omagh Cardiac Assessment Unit.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Receptionists
body: Received  a Doctors telephone call which I missed by a second picking up the phone, Rang back immediately Receptionist said Id have to join the appointment que which was number 21 what.. Practice surely should have a Direct Line for such Calls appalling service from a Doctors. .Receptionist need more compassion, Understanding, and humanity. especially when people are poorly

title: Careless people in business of care
body: We moved into new development during Covid and registered with the practice as it was closer to home. I have type 2 diabetes and there is hardly any check-up for me and there is hardly an occasion when I was given medicine on time. As a gown man, I can live with these dysfunctionalities. But for almost a month we have been calling the surgery for my daughter who has a cough with rattling sounds and constantly getting fever. Our calls so far could not get any further than reception, and we get the same message "No appointment calls us back". Today we requested a senior person with the responsibility to answer our queries. As this is an ongoing issue and we are concerned that giving her painkillers on a long-term basis could affect her kidney/liver. We also highlight that this could be a sign of leukaemia, however, the surgery has not responded to our appeals. We are seriously concerned because it concerns the health of a 4-year-old. NHS should investigate and take appropriate action to stop such behaviour.

title: Great advice
body: Very professional, got really good advice. Did what I needed. Corrected my problem in less than 4 sessions.

title: Terrible access and no care
body: Finding it hard to have any help from this appalling practice. Can’t get through on the phone. E consult is switched off for the entirety of the bank holiday weekend. To be switched on again at 8am Tuesday! Begin the long winded econsult at 8 Tuesday but during the time it takes to answer the numerous questions this is switched off. Leaving it then too late to call for an appointment! Use the urgent care centre so wait there 4 hours to be told that the gp surgery is the only route to access the services I need in a timely manner. Econsult is again switched off until 12.01 am. Stay up till this time and at 12.05 get a message saying the practice are no longer accepting requests. I will try again at 8 to call but have no faith whatsoever in this surgery
